New Records: Mohammad Amir took 2 wickets in the first 6 overs, contributing to Pakistan's strong start.
Mohammad Rizwan scored 53 not out, the slowest fifty in Pakistan's T20 history.
Pakistan achieved their highest successful chase at New York, scoring 107-3 from 17.3 overs.
Key Match Events: Fakhar Zaman was dismissed on 4 after a missed catch but Pakistan still managed to chase down the target.
Babar Azam fell just short of 50 but set up the partnership with Rizwan.
Usman Khan hit the winning runs with a two off Gordon's delivery in the 18th over.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan captain Babar Azam emphasized the importance of the first six overs due to the double-paced pitch.
Canada captain Saad Bin Zafar noted the difficulty of batting early and the impact of losing the toss.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan coach highlighted the win as crucial for their Super 8s hopes.
Canada's Saad Bin Zafar acknowledged the slim chances of qualification despite the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Pakistan's first win in the tournament, keeping their qualification hopes alive.
Canada's performance was hindered by a negative run rate, affecting their qualification chances.
